intro: Horkelia gordonii var. alpicola, commonly known as the alpine horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Horkelia gordonii var. alpicola is often found in meadows and slopes at high elevations.
